intro: Psychotria macrophylla, commonly known as the giant psychotria, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves that can grow up to 30 cm in length. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often accompanied by a strong, unpleasant odor. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Psychotria macrophylla is also known for its toxic properties, containing various alkaloids that can be harmful to humans and animals.
